results.title: Australia: beyond the fatal shore [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Spencer, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description: Art critic Robert Hughes considers his relationship to Australia, 35 years after leaving the country in this television documentary series. Contemplative after his near fatal car accident, Hughes reflects fondly on his childhood in Australia and explores contemporary Australian culture with an appreciation that only came after he was forced to question his mortality. Written by Robert Hughes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Spencer, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and Oxford Film and Television

results.title: Australia: a technological society?
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This final episode examines the increasing impact of technology throughout all Australian industry. Increases in productivity are linked to the growing mechanisation of industries and a resultant change to traditional work practices. As a direct result of increased mechanisation, workers now need to retrain and be educated in using new technologies. Through interviews with employees and management the impact of technology on working life is discussed, as well as the effects technology will have on Australian society in the future.

results.title: Australia: a fair and reasonable community?
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This episode examines wealth and the distribution of wealth in Australian society. Though considered a fair and equitable society, the video introduces us to the people who are not involved in “wealth production”: the unemployed. An examination is made of the social welfare system in Australia and the importance of the Trade Union movement in fighting for the rights and for the safety of organised labour.

results.title: Australia. Ep. 5. Woy Woy to Wagga Wagga
results.brief_description: Spike Milligan takes a journey around “his” Australia, from Woy Woy where his mother lives, to Wagga Wagga - with Sydney and Canberra in between. His journey includes watching the Melbourne Cup with his mother, spinning yarns with locals in a pub, and the search for the great Australian joke. Milligan’s personal insight into Australia and Australians is both humorous and an interesting retrospective of the country in the 1980’s.

results.title: Australia, Where Time Began
results.brief_description: Ravaged by time, wind, water and a scorching sun, the world’s most extraordinary landscape has evolved - a landscape of contrast, mystery and awe. This film is an explanation of how the deserts, salt lakes, monoliths, escarpments and gorges of the planet’s only island continent were created. It also portrays the endearing animals and plants which have adapted to an often hostile environment.

results.title: Australia, land of everchange
results.brief_description: Displays the infinite variety of the vast Australian continent - its snow fields and tropic reefs, its mountains and plains, its city life and agriculture, its indigenous peoples and advanced civilization, its unique native animals and notable farm stock.

results.title: Australia you're standing in it
results.creator_credit: Kris Noble, John Eastway and ABC Video
results.brief_description: Featuring a wealth of talent and innovation from Stephen Blackburn, Geoff Brooks, Peter Brown, Sue Ingleton, Mary Keneally, Rod Quantock and Tim Robertson, this was arguably the first ‘truly Australian’ comedy show, originating from the comedy clubs of Brunswick Street, Melbourne in the mid 1970s. Featuring such classic characters as Tim & Debbie, The Dodgey Brothers and Chunky Custard.
